column2: KANSAS DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Kansas

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 2. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 3. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 4. Blind spots are:
column4: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.

column2: 5. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 6. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
7. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 8. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 9. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column4: over your shoulders.

column2: 10. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 11. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
column4: railroad crossing.

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 13. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hospital service
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 14. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: AFTER you move.

column2: 15. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.

column2: 16. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
column4: a traffic enforcement officer.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right

column2: 18. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more quickly

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column6: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 20. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 21. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 22. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
column4: more intoxicated.

column2: 23. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 24. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 25. If your vehicle is equipped with ABS and you need to stop quickly, you should:
column4: press on the brake pedal as hard as you can and keep pressing on it.
column6: press hard on the brakes, then let up on the brake pedal.
column8: gently apply the brakes and hold the steering wheel firmly.
